Claim: A video shows a man spitting inside food packets during the coronavirus crisis.
Explaination: The video is old and out of context, the man in the video blew on the plastic bag to open it up..
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video shows a man spitting inside food packets during the coronavirus crisis.

Explanation:The video is old and out of context, the man in the video blew on the plastic bag to open it up..

https://www.factcrescendo.com/fact-check-muslim-man-spitting-in-food-packet-viral-amidst-coronavirus/

Claim: A photo shows the newly built hospital in Wuhan.
Explaination: The viral image was taken from an online listing and is actually a modular apartment building.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: A photo shows the newly built hospital in Wuhan.

Explanation:The viral image was taken from an online listing and is actually a modular apartment building.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_14679223

Claim: A member of Tablighi Jamaat is roaming naked and misbehaving with hospital staff.
Explaination: This claim is completely false and the incident actually happened in August 2019 in Karachi. It has nothing to do with Tablighi Jamaatis or the current outbreak of the novel coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A member of Tablighi Jamaat is roaming naked and misbehaving with hospital staff.

Explanation:This claim is completely false and the incident actually happened in August 2019 in Karachi. It has nothing to do with Tablighi Jamaatis or the current outbreak of the novel coronavirus.

https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/old-video-from-pakistan-shared-to-claim-tablighi-jamaat-man-roaming-naked-fact-check

Claim: Hindu man in Rajasthan killed by Muslims amidst lockdown.
Explaination: The video is originally from Pakistan where a man was maimed by his wife's relatives.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Hindu man in Rajasthan killed by Muslims amidst lockdown.

Explanation:The video is originally from Pakistan where a man was maimed by his wife's relatives.

https://www.factcrescendo.com/fact-check-hindu-man-killed-by-muslims-in-rajasthan/

Claim: “An entire family” in Santolan, Pasig, is “confirmed to be infected” with the novel coronavirus, according to what looked like a breaking news graphic from GMA News.
Explaination: Pasig City Mayor Vico Sotto called the graphic a “fake ‘GMA’ post.” Moreover, the social media team of GMA News said they did not release the “JUST IN” graphic that circulated online.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “An entire family” in Santolan, Pasig, is “confirmed to be infected” with the novel coronavirus, according to what looked like a breaking news graphic from GMA News.

Explanation:Pasig City Mayor Vico Sotto called the graphic a “fake ‘GMA’ post.” Moreover, the social media team of GMA News said they did not release the “JUST IN” graphic that circulated online.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/253981-entire-family-pasig-infected-novel-coronavirus

Claim: A picture claims that an Italian man committed suicide after his whole family succumbed to COVID-19
Explaination: The image is of a woman committing suicide in Spain in December 2019. BOOM could not establish what drove the woman to take such a step.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A picture claims that an Italian man committed suicide after his whole family succumbed to COVID-19

Explanation:The image is of a woman committing suicide in Spain in December 2019. BOOM could not establish what drove the woman to take such a step.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/dated-photos-of-a-suicide-in-spain-falsely-linked-to-coronavirus-in-italy-7370

Claim: Employer covered up part of a poster on virus prevention that advised people to stay home when sick.
Explaination: The part that was covered up on the poster advises people to avoid large gatherings.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Employer covered up part of a poster on virus prevention that advised people to stay home when sick.

Explanation:The part that was covered up on the poster advises people to avoid large gatherings.

https://factcheck.afp.com/employer-did-not-hide-advice-skip-work-covid-19-poster

Claim: Photo of an Italian doctor waving goodbye to co-doctors as he is about to die due to coronavirus.
Explaination: The viral photo was taken at a hospital in China's Wuhan when the team of doctors was treating a COVID-19 patient.
Label: half true
html:
Claim: Photo of an Italian doctor waving goodbye to co-doctors as he is about to die due to coronavirus.

Explanation:The viral photo was taken at a hospital in China's Wuhan when the team of doctors was treating a COVID-19 patient.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/misleading-claim-about-covid19-patient-goes-viral-1663343-2020-04-04

Claim: Multiple posts shared repeatedly on Facebook and Twitter claim that a Hong Kong medical lab has warned the novel coronavirus can remain viable on fruits and vegetables for 12 hours, therefore people should “avoid salads” over fears of contracting COVID-19.
Explaination: The claim is false; the Centre for Food Safety in Hong Kong said there is no evidence to suggest that the virus is transmitted through food produce; the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the European Food Safety Authority (EFSA) have also separately said there is "no evidence" that COVID-19 has been transmitted through food.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Multiple posts shared repeatedly on Facebook and Twitter claim that a Hong Kong medical lab has warned the novel coronavirus can remain viable on fruits and vegetables for 12 hours, therefore people should “avoid salads” over fears of contracting COVID-19.

Explanation:The claim is false; the Centre for Food Safety in Hong Kong said there is no evidence to suggest that the virus is transmitted through food produce; the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the European Food Safety Authority (EFSA) have also separately said there is "no evidence" that COVID-19 has been transmitted through food.

https://factcheck.afp.com/hoax-circulates-online-hong-kong-covid-19-was-transmitted-through-fruits-and-vegetables

Claim: The government is closing businesses to stop the spread of coronavirus even though “the numbers are nothing compared to H1N1 or Ebola. Everyone needs to realize our government is up to something …”
Explaination: Any suggestion that the coronavirus isn't real or that it’s part of a government conspiracy is a ridiculous claim.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: The government is closing businesses to stop the spread of coronavirus even though “the numbers are nothing compared to H1N1 or Ebola. Everyone needs to realize our government is up to something …”

Explanation:Any suggestion that the coronavirus isn't real or that it’s part of a government conspiracy is a ridiculous claim.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/06/facebook-posts/fact-checking-viral-pa-facebook-post-coronavirus-s/

Claim: A video has been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook, Weibo and Twitter that claim it shows people who committed suicide in the U.S. after contracting COVID-19.
Explaination: The claim is false; the video was published in 2014 news reports about a group of migrants who died after a boat sank off the coast of Libya.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video has been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook, Weibo and Twitter that claim it shows people who committed suicide in the U.S. after contracting COVID-19.

Explanation:The claim is false; the video was published in 2014 news reports about a group of migrants who died after a boat sank off the coast of Libya.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-first-appeared-2014-reports-about-migrants-who-drowned-libyan-coast

Claim: A military Humvee labeled “COVID-19 quarantine team” was on Interstate 696 in Michigan.
Explaination: The same image has been shared and described as a vehicle spotted in Ohio and London in the United Kingdom.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A military Humvee labeled “COVID-19 quarantine team” was on Interstate 696 in Michigan.

Explanation:The same image has been shared and described as a vehicle spotted in Ohio and London in the United Kingdom.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/25/viral-image/no-military-doesnt-have-covid-19-quarantine-team-h/

Claim: A photo of a Sri Lankan military hospital has been shared thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts alongside a claim that it has been reserved exclusively for the use of “VIPs” who test positive for COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: The claim is misleading; Sri Lankan military and hospital authorities told AFP that the military hospital and the country's other medical facilities are being prepared for all COVID-19 patients.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: A photo of a Sri Lankan military hospital has been shared thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts alongside a claim that it has been reserved exclusively for the use of “VIPs” who test positive for COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:The claim is misleading; Sri Lankan military and hospital authorities told AFP that the military hospital and the country's other medical facilities are being prepared for all COVID-19 patients.

https://factcheck.afp.com/sri-lankan-authorities-say-medical-facilities-hospital-will-remain-open-all-covid-19-patients?check=1

Claim: Chart compares COVID-19 with other longstanding diseases.
Explaination: The graphic is misleading and risks underplaying the danger of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, which is a new disease with a fast-rising mortality rate.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Chart compares COVID-19 with other longstanding diseases.

Explanation:The graphic is misleading and risks underplaying the danger of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, which is a new disease with a fast-rising mortality rate.

https://factcheck.afp.com/health-experts-say-comparing-death-tolls-emerging-epidemic-longstanding-diseases-risks-underplaying

Claim: A claim has been shared on Facebook and several Sri Lankan news websites that Muslims at a mosque in Sri Lanka reacted violently after authorities told them their gathering was in violation of the country’s novel coronavirus curfew.
Explaination: The claim is misleading; police and public health officials said that locals were in fact asked to gather at the mosque to receive tests to detect COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus. The scuffle that occurred at the event was sparked over fears that the testing site would make the village more susceptible to infections, they said.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A claim has been shared on Facebook and several Sri Lankan news websites that Muslims at a mosque in Sri Lanka reacted violently after authorities told them their gathering was in violation of the country’s novel coronavirus curfew.

Explanation:The claim is misleading; police and public health officials said that locals were in fact asked to gather at the mosque to receive tests to detect COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus. The scuffle that occurred at the event was sparked over fears that the testing site would make the village more susceptible to infections, they said.

https://factcheck.afp.com/misleading-claim-circulates-muslims-ignored-covid-19-curfew-sri-lankan-mosque

Claim: Chennai municipal corporation has asked all vegetable and fruit markets to shut down.
Explaination: No such order was issued. All vegetable and fruit markets are open in Chennai.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Chennai municipal corporation has asked all vegetable and fruit markets to shut down.

Explanation:No such order was issued. All vegetable and fruit markets are open in Chennai.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-viral-message-of-chennai-veggies-markets-shutting-due-to-coronavirus-is-a-hoax-1657146-2020-03-18

Claim: Posts shared more than 20,000 times on Facebook feature a photo of a crying child and two others showing a woman and a man in hospital beds, claiming that the boy’s parents are infected with the novel coronavirus
Explaination: This is false, the pictures do not depict a family and circulated online prior to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Posts shared more than 20,000 times on Facebook feature a photo of a crying child and two others showing a woman and a man in hospital beds, claiming that the boy’s parents are infected with the novel coronavirus

Explanation:This is false, the pictures do not depict a family and circulated online prior to the COVID-19 pandemic.

https://factcheck.afp.com/photos-vaping-illness-patients-used-make-false-covid-19-claim

Claim: Hair Weaves And Lace Front Wigs Made In China Likely To Contain coronavirus.
Explaination: There is very little chance of coronavirus spreading this way, and there have not been any reported cases of this happening.
Label: Unlikely
html:
Claim: Hair Weaves And Lace Front Wigs Made In China Likely To Contain coronavirus.

Explanation:There is very little chance of coronavirus spreading this way, and there have not been any reported cases of this happening.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471766-fact-check-hair-weaves-and-lace-front-wigs-made-in-china-not-likely-to-contain-coronavirus.html

Claim: President Donald Trump is “announcing tomorrow that the U.S. is going into quarantine for the next 14 days.”
Explaination: There was no evidence by March 16 that the federal government was set to announce a nationwide lockdown. President Trump said he was not considering it. Trump said the government is thinking about additional measures to prevent the spread of COVID-19 in some hotspots around the country.
Label: False
html:
Claim: President Donald Trump is “announcing tomorrow that the U.S. is going into quarantine for the next 14 days.”

Explanation:There was no evidence by March 16 that the federal government was set to announce a nationwide lockdown. President Trump said he was not considering it. Trump said the government is thinking about additional measures to prevent the spread of COVID-19 in some hotspots around the country.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/17/chain-message/fact-checking-chain-message-about-national-quarant/

Claim: “59 people die as pastor gives them Dettol to drink in church to prevent coronavirus.”
Explaination: There’s no evidence 59 people died from drinking the cleaning product Dettol to prevent the coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “59 people die as pastor gives them Dettol to drink in church to prevent coronavirus.”

Explanation:There’s no evidence 59 people died from drinking the cleaning product Dettol to prevent the coronavirus.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/08/viral-image/no-evidence-59-people-died-drinking-disinfectant-p/

Claim: A photo shows people infected with coronavirus  lying on the sidewalk in China.
Explaination: It was an artistic performance in germany in 2014.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A photo shows people infected with coronavirus lying on the sidewalk in China.

Explanation:It was an artistic performance in germany in 2014.

https://factcheck.afp.com/2014-photo-people-participating-art-project-frankfurt-germany

Claim: Chinese are converting to Islam after realizing that no Muslim was affected by COVID-19 in the country.
Explaination: The viral video is old and not related to coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Chinese are converting to Islam after realizing that no Muslim was affected by COVID-19 in the country.

Explanation:The viral video is old and not related to coronavirus.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_14901149

Claim: A photo of a Sri Lankan military hospital has been shared thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts alongside a claim that it has been reserved exclusively for the use of “VIPs” who test positive for COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: The claim is misleading; Sri Lankan military and hospital authorities told AFP that the military hospital and the country's other medical facilities are being prepared for all COVID-19 patients.
Label: misleading
html:
Claim: A photo of a Sri Lankan military hospital has been shared thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts alongside a claim that it has been reserved exclusively for the use of “VIPs” who test positive for COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:The claim is misleading; Sri Lankan military and hospital authorities told AFP that the military hospital and the country's other medical facilities are being prepared for all COVID-19 patients.

https://factcheck.afp.com/sri-lankan-authorities-say-medical-facilities-hospital-will-remain-open-all-covid-19-patients

Claim: Muslims are licking their plates to spread coronavirus and infect more people with the virus.
Explaination: The video is from three years ago depicting a Dawoodi Bohra practice of licking the plate clean so as to prevent any food from being wasted before washing and is not linked to the coronavirus outbreak.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Muslims are licking their plates to spread coronavirus and infect more people with the virus.

Explanation:The video is from three years ago depicting a Dawoodi Bohra practice of licking the plate clean so as to prevent any food from being wasted before washing and is not linked to the coronavirus outbreak.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/false-video-shows-muslims-licking-utensils-to-spread-coronavirus-7477

Claim: NYT invented the video of a doctor fighting coronavirus in hospital.
Explaination: The video is real and Dr. Colleen Smith does work at the hospital, unlike the Tweet claims.
Label: False
html:
Claim: NYT invented the video of a doctor fighting coronavirus in hospital.

Explanation:The video is real and Dr. Colleen Smith does work at the hospital, unlike the Tweet claims.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/04/fact-check-nytimes-did-not-invent-doctor-fighting-coronavirus-in-qanon-conspiracy-theory.html

Claim: People are lying on the ground in China because they contracted the coronavirus.
Explaination: Video comes from South Africa during a initiation rite in a private school.
Label: False
html:
Claim: People are lying on the ground in China because they contracted the coronavirus.

Explanation:Video comes from South Africa during a initiation rite in a private school.

https://observers.france24.com/fr/20200210-intox-video-coronavirus-chine-attention-afrique-sud

Claim: Picture shows the Mecca totally empty.
Explaination: The picture is from a miniature designed by an artist.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Picture shows the Mecca totally empty.

Explanation:The picture is from a miniature designed by an artist.

https://observers.france24.com/fr/20200313-coronavirus-intox-monde-arabe-observateurs-mecque-saddam-hussein?check=1

Claim: Last photo of Indonesian doctor Hadio Ali standing away from his family before he passed away from COVID-19
Explaination: The picture is of a Malaysian doctor not infected by COVID-19 but who is treating COVID-19 patients in Malaysia and this was him before he left for duty.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Last photo of Indonesian doctor Hadio Ali standing away from his family before he passed away from COVID-19

Explanation:The picture is of a Malaysian doctor not infected by COVID-19 but who is treating COVID-19 patients in Malaysia and this was him before he left for duty.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/false-indonesian-doctors-last-photo-before-he-died-of-covid-19-7352

Claim: Chinese people rush to Japan to abuse Japanese health insurance system.
Explaination: According to Ministry of Health, this information is mostly false.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: Chinese people rush to Japan to abuse Japanese health insurance system.

Explanation:According to Ministry of Health, this information is mostly false.

https://www.buzzfeed.com/jp/saoriibuki/corona-virus-health-insurance

Claim: Wisconsin Governor Tony Evers is “pushing firearm confiscation orders.”
Explaination: A Facebook post finding new life amid the coronavirus outbreak says Evers is pushing gun confiscation, but the linked article is from April 2019. At that time, Evers had not proposed any such thing, and the article only details a call for red flag laws from the attorney general. So what was wrong in 2019 is now both wrong and ridiculous.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: Wisconsin Governor Tony Evers is “pushing firearm confiscation orders.”

Explanation:A Facebook post finding new life amid the coronavirus outbreak says Evers is pushing gun confiscation, but the linked article is from April 2019. At that time, Evers had not proposed any such thing, and the article only details a call for red flag laws from the attorney general. So what was wrong in 2019 is now both wrong and ridiculous.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/25/facebook-posts/old-claim-tony-evers-and-gun-confiscation-wrong/

Claim: Bat market and bat meat being sold in Wuhan.
Explaination: Video taken in Indonesia (Manado)
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Bat market and bat meat being sold in Wuhan.

Explanation:Video taken in Indonesia (Manado)

https://observers.france24.com/fr/20200130-intox-chine-soupe-chauve-souris-rumeur-origine-coronavirus

Claim: A post says that if you hold your breath you can tell if you are infected with Covid-19 or not.
Explaination: A pulmonologist and member of the National Public Health Commission assured that this exercise doesn’t have any clinical applicability and it’s not safe. You can do the exercise, pass it and be infected with Covid-19.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: A post says that if you hold your breath you can tell if you are infected with Covid-19 or not.

Explanation:A pulmonologist and member of the National Public Health Commission assured that this exercise doesn’t have any clinical applicability and it’s not safe. You can do the exercise, pass it and be infected with Covid-19.

https://observador.pt/factchecks/suster-a-respiracao-e-um-teste-que-mostra-se-a-pessoa-esta-infetada-com-coronavirus/

Claim: “The Chinese Communist Party is using Zoom as a way to spy on our citizens.”
Explaination: The claim is based on a report from researchers at the University of Toronto. But one of the researchers told us that while they identified security issues with Zoom, whether China has exploited the platform for espionage was not something they considered.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: “The Chinese Communist Party is using Zoom as a way to spy on our citizens.”

Explanation:The claim is based on a report from researchers at the University of Toronto. But one of the researchers told us that while they identified security issues with Zoom, whether China has exploited the platform for espionage was not something they considered.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/07/charlie-kirk/china-spying-you-through-zoom-charlie-kirk-oversta/

Claim: Photo shows a man wearing a “government issued Saint Laurent hazardous materials suit.”
Explaination: The image was posted by a self-described parody account.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Photo shows a man wearing a “government issued Saint Laurent hazardous materials suit.”

Explanation:The image was posted by a self-described parody account.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/03/viral-image/photo-florida-intern-hazmat-suit-due-coronavirus-p/

Claim: Food and locations are contaminated in Australia.
Explaination: Authorities denied those claims.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Food and locations are contaminated in Australia.

Explanation:Authorities denied those claims.
